intro: Cremanthodium nobile var. nobile, commonly known as the noble sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the high alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically linear and covered in fine hairs, adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous environments.
